titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Leroy D. King, Indictment
CWG11250

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Madison Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against
Leroy D King}

The Grand Jury of Madison County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Leroy D King of the Crime of Murder Commited as follows Viz. The said Leroy D King on the 20th day of September 1860 in the county aforesaid did feloniously and with Mallice & forthought Kill & Murder James Lackey by striking him on the head and person with rocks clubs, and other heavy missles and weapons from the effect of which blows and striking the said Lackey died against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

1860 Sept 26th found & processed & Issued
"we of the Jury find the Prisoner Guilty -- of Manslaughter and Confinement in the Penitentiary for two years
Thos H Embry"

State of Kentucky
Madison Circuit Court } Sct

I James M. Shackelford clerk of said court certify that the foregoing page contains a true copy of the Indictment in the case of The Commonwealth against Leroy D King found at the Septr Term 1860, and also a true copy of the verdict rendered by the Jury at the present March Term of said court.
Given under my hand this 20th day of March 1862.

Commonwealth
vs }
Leroy D King
Copy Indictment & & Verdict
